pr_title: Issue #5122 - Improve connection statistics for WebSocket

timeline.message:
Issue #5122 - add specialized Connection.Listener for WebSocket ConnectionStatistics

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

Issue #5122 - make number of active WS Sessions a managed attribute on SessionTracker

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

timeline.bodyText:
I think this could be generalised as we now probably need the same thing for HTTP stats maybe HTTP2 stats etc.
So perhaps put a protected method into ConnectionStatistics that asks if a connection should be included.... perhaps with the default implementation checking in IncludeExcludeSet of classes?
timeline.author: gregw
timeline.diffHunk:

+package org.eclipse.jetty.websocket.common.util;
+
+import org.eclipse.jetty.io.Connection;
+import org.eclipse.jetty.io.ConnectionStatistics;
+import org.eclipse.jetty.websocket.common.io.AbstractWebSocketConnection;
+
+public class WebSocketConnectionStatistics extends ConnectionStatistics

replies.bodyText: Hmm perhaps keep the base class the same for efficiency, but have an IncludeExclude version derived
replies.author: gregw

timeline.message:
Issue #5125 - Generalise WebSocketConnectionStatistics into IncludeExcludeConnectionStatistics

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

timeline.author: gregw
gregw

timeline.bodyText:
rather than create your own set type just to provide a predicate is is probably simpler to use:
new IncludeExcludeSet<>(new HashSet<>(), Connection.class::isAssignableFrom, new HashSet<>(), Connection.class::isAssignableFrom);
timeline.author: gregw

replies.author: lachlan-roberts

timeline.message:
remove tri-state logic from IncludeExcludeConnectionStatistics

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>
